name: Riddles, Good with Mead
text:
Riddles, Good with Mead
by Jyrrul Meadspitter
of the
Bards College of Haafingar



Presented herein are all manner of riddles, to enjoy with friends on a cold night.

I touch your feet
And Hoaga's mouth
I spawn unruled
At Drajkmyr's Hold
To most I'm nothing, but for a bird
I hide a hoard of mites and worms

I lurk and I prowl
Neither squeak nor howl
Quiet like the snow
My face don't know
But my flesh still rips
Under a Nord's grip

I roll over tongues
Light fires in bellies
Make the world roil
'Til Men greet the ground
My comp'ny brings sleep
Though sought by the gods

I can be heavy or light
Be sorrowful or happy
Surrounded by strings, unshackled
Locked in humid cages, untameable
Quick to escape I fly the wind
I grow and spread unbound by walls
